p: By race, African Americans (OR 2.97, 99% CI 2.05–4.31) and Hispanics (OR 1.80, 99% CI 1.17–2.78) had higher odds of receiving an HIV test during an office visit than Whites. Self-pay individuals (OR 0.47, 99% CI 0.24–0.94) had lower odds of HIV testing compared with the privately insured. Patients visiting for preventive care had higher odds for testing (OR 5.29, 95% CI 3.25–8.61) compared to those with a chronic problem. For ED visits, only 2 patient-level variables – race and ethnicity showed significant associations with HIV testing (Table 4). African Americans (OR 3.44, 99% CI 2.27–5.22) and Hispanics (OR 2.24, 99% CI 1.51–3.31) had higher odds of getting tested compared to non-Hispanic Whites.
